did.unittitle: D. Ditmars letter to John Ditmars
did.abstract: One letter from D. Ditmars to his brother John Ditmars in Jamaica, New York, from the colony of Exxequebo (Essequibo), British Guyana, dated 1802. In letter he expresses his pleasure at hearing news from friends and family back home, describes the colony where he is staying, and describes a number of local birds he has observed in the area. The Ditmars (also spelled Ditmas) were a prominent family who owned property in Kings County and Queens County, New York, from the 17th century onward.
